text: :Not to be confused with Radio direction finding (also RDF and also antenna- associated) Relative Directivity Factor (RDF) is a figure of merit for radio receiving antennas; it is the antenna gain in the forward direction divided by the gain in all other directions. It is also called the Signal to Noise Improvement Factor (SNIF). ==References== Category:Antennas (radio)
title: Relative directivity factor
